header.title: Mark Labbett: 'Everyday sexism' The Chase star addresses Jenny Ryan ‘sacking’ remarks
header.subtitle: MARK LABBETT, who is widely known as The Beast on ITV quiz show The Chase, defended his co-star Jenny Ryan after Twitter users allegedly called for her to be sacked following a recent episode.
header.postText: 'The Chase veteran Mark Labbett, 53, referred to the remarks made by Twitter users as everyday sexism after he revealed he had never been urged to leave the show. Jenny, 37, who is widely known as The Vixen, shut down a troll who said her performance on a recent episode was s ** t  after a solo player won a whopping £70,000. Hitting back, she informed the Twitter user they were missing an apostrophe in their tweet. The user responded saying her performance was appalling, to which she replied: My performance through most of the show was above par.', 'I may have lost the Final but that was because my opponent was OUTSTANDING, not because I was ‘appalling’. Nothing to defend - I was outplayed. #TheChase.', 'Mark weighed in on the debate, tweeting: Interesting, Jenny has by FAR the best win-loss record on #thechase over the last three years yet the moment she loses (to a great solo 20) somebody calls for her to be sacked. Everyday Sexism?', 'She then asked her colleague: “I was wondering - how much of this do you get when you lose, Mark ? I do wonder if there 's a gender thing.', 'Mark replied: Nobody has EVER called for me to be sacked or replaced.', 'Jenny responded: Really ? I have seen about a dozen in my mentions alone in the last 20 minutes.I even get these comments when I win : (', 'Many of Jenny’ s followers also flocked to her page to share their support.', 'One user wrote: Well said Mark, too many people hide behind a keyboard. ', 'Thought @jenlion & @BradleyWalsh reactions were lovely at the end.Well done to all.', ' Jenny addressed the negative comments after she lost the game to solo contestant Judith, who scooped an eye - watering£ 70, 000 against her last week. ', 'The Vixen took to Twitter to praise Judith, writing: I’ ve been awaiting the broadcast of this episode...Judith is such a memorable contestant!#TheChase.', 'One user commented: Fair play Jenny.I absolutely loved some of your facial expressions as she kept pulling out answers, left, right and centre #TheChase #Judith.', 'Jenny replied: Absolute perfect play by Judith.£70 k at table with nothing to lose.', 'She set a very strong 20, which forced me to rush slightly. ', 'Then capitalised on my errors by nailing pushbacks - which further put the time pressure on me, leading to more errors.#TheChase. ', 'Another user replied: She was fabulous and I thought you and Bradley were really kind to her and gave her the credit she deserved.', 'The Chase airs weekdays at 5 pm on ITV.'

commentThread.commentText: Some of the answers by  Judith, in the push backs, were outstanding as were many of her other answers.   Jenny's answers were also outstanding, but 20 answers to catch someone on the chase is challenging for any chaser i.e. One answer every 6 seconds Any hesitation or  wrong answer puts even more pressure on the chaser. Judith did very well, unfortunately Jenny couldn't match her in this instance. I expected Judith to lose. I was pleasantly surprised. She deserved to win.
Bradders makes it the best quiz show on TV, but I have no problem with Jenny or any of the others. Long may it continue!
The Chase  would be boring if the chasers won every week. We need a big winner now and then or the show would be pointless boom boom!!  A bit like Celtic winning every week.

replies.commentText: So no male chaser gets Abu’s yet she gets load,explain how that’s not sexism?

commentThread.commentText: its   quite simple,,,keep  off   twitter   and  facebook  etc,,,,they   will  eventually   end   civilisation,,,depression  is  rampant   already  because   complete   strangers  harm  you  with  words,,,if   we   go  back   to  proper   friends and  talking   every  one   would  be   well again
Just can't warm to that Jenny woman; she knows  a lot but ....... !

replies.commentText: She's good but I'm not keen on the image they chose for her.

commentThread.commentText: Do we now have to have a quota of " fat people "on these tele programmes as well !!!

replies.commentText: Are fat people simply better at quizzes? Or is being overweight a consequence of sitting down every night doing quizzes or swatting for them, when they could be in the gym?
Deleteime,  I thought that the " as well " would cover it sufficiently, i do agree entirely with your sentiments  !!!

commentThread.commentText: Jenny seems to win more than the others lately, but if she had won there would be troll nasties calling her. So many sad people nowadays.
Just stop reading the stupid twittergram.

Why people bother to get into on line spats is beyond me. Personally I don't use Twitter, Facebook or the other social platforms. I like face to face spats, there's no argument an uppercut can't sort out!

I loved this episode, not because Jenny lost but because the the lady was so unassuming so good! I agree with Beastie Boy, its probably some angry misogynist idiot thumping away with his ham fists without a thought of what he 's doing! I
